Dear Si:
I am in receipt of a copy of your letter to Dr. J.R. Morton
dated February 13 naming Burton Paulu and me to a committee to work
with the NUEA in the evaluation of Extension activities in the various
colleges and universities in the country. This appointment was in
reply to a letter from Dr. Morton which I presented to the NAEB
Board meeting on January 18.
I am enclosing a second copy of Dr. Morton's letter wherein he
outlines his work as Chairman of the NUEA Committee on Implications
of Atomic Energy and requests the cooperation of NAEB in exploring'
iu possibilities for expanding the work of this committee through
use of radio. At a later date, I wrote you that Dr. Morton had been
appointed to conduct an NUEA-FAE study of the total Extension Division
activities of American colleges and universities. You apparently
confused his original letter with my later one and appointed Burton
and me to the latter project rather than the former. Dr. Morton
this morning expressed to me the opinion that in actuality this is
a desirable step and he would be pleased to have you name a committee
to work with him on the NUEA Extension evaluation project as well as
a committee to work on the AEC project and feels that this might
very well be the same committee for both projects.
Permit me to suggest, as I have to Dr. Morton, that, because of
the nature of the NUEA Extension Division evaluation project, a
research man such as Dallas Smythe should be added to this committee.
If this meets with your approval, I believe it would be in order for
you to write Dr. Morton naming Burton, Dallas, and me to the NAEB
Committee to work with the National University Extension Association's
Committee on Implications of Atomic Energy and, to work with him on the
NUEA evaluation project.
It was good seeing you in Illinois last week and I shall look
forward to seeing you at our Oklahoma meeting.
